title: Nicole Kidman and Charlize Theron speak on a panel at the BAFTA
text:
They're co-stars in the upcoming political drama Bombshell.

And Nicole Kidman and Charlize Theron came out to push their upcoming project as they spoke on a panel at a BAFTA screening of the flick on Saturday in New York.

Kidman, 52, donned a grey cashmere sweater over a white shirt and medium-wash jeans.

Up-front: Nicole Kidman and Charlize Theron came out to push their upcoming project as they spoke on a panel at a BAFTA screening of the flick on Saturday in New York

She paired the casual look with black boots that featured a chunky heel.

Theron, 44, wore a black blazer, a silk shirt and white pants with navy pinstripes.

Her feet navigated the event in a pair of black pointed-toe pumps.

Screen stars: Theron and Kidman star in the upcoming political drama Bombshell

Bombshell centers on a group of female employees at Fox News who take on a toxic male culture, leading to the downfall of media mogul Roger Ailes, according to an official synopsis.

The film was directed by Jay Roach, who said of the film's character inspirations: 'These were women who would not have necessarily called themselves feminists and sometimes even were anti–politically correct.'

He added: 'And they ended up being the people that spoke up.'

Bombshell also stars Margot Robbie, Jon Lithgow, Kate McKinnon and Allison Janney.

Theron, who also serves as a producer for the film, told Entertainment Weekly of her experience preparing for it: 'All of my other issues that I have with that world, I had to put all of that aside because the story is worth telling.'

'It doesn’t have anything to do with how I feel about Fox News or how I feel about Republicans. That’s not what this film is about at all.'

Engaged: Theron, who also serves as a producer for the film, told Entertainment Weekly of her experience preparing for it: 'All of my other issues that I have with that world, I had to put all of that aside because the story is worth telling'

Theron spent hours in the makeup chair in order to transform into journalist Megyn Kelly for the finished product.

She also took the time to study footage of Kelly, especially her unscripted interviews.

'She’s pretty hard, and she comes across a certain way that feels very strong and very much like you can’t break through any of that wall,' she said.

'But there are moments where you watch her - especially after [the events in Bombshell] take place - where you can see some of her vulnerability.'

Bombshell is set for release on Dec. 20, 2019.

On-the-go: Kidman arrived with a smile to the event with a burgundy leather purse

Screen star: Theron signed autographs when she arrived to the event

Chatty: Theron and Kidman stopped to have a conversation with an audience member

Listening: Kidman plays journalist Gretchen Carlson in Bombshell

Group shot! John Lithgow, who plays Ailes, Kidman and Theron posed for a photo alongside one another at one point
